method.text: Place the swordfish steaks on a grill pan. In a bowl, mix together the lemon juice, oil, and seasoning.  Brush the mixture over the fish.
Grill for 4 min each side. When turning over, brush the other side with any of the remaining oil mixture.
Meanwhile, heat the butter and oil in a frying pan. Add the shallot and apple slices and fry together for 3-4 min until softened slightly. Remove from pan with a slotted spoon.
Add the apple juice and all the stock except 1 tablespoon, to the pan. Mix the remaining tablespoon of stock with the cornflour to form a smooth paste.

Bring the apple juice and stock to the boil. Stir in the cornflour paste, stirring constantly, and simmer gently for 1-2 min until thickened slightly. Return the shallots and apples to the sauce with the tarragon and heat through for 2 min.
Transfer the cooked swordfish to warmed serving plates. Pour over the sauce. Garnish with tarragon sprigs and serve immediately.

title: Apple and tarragon baked swordfish
